contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Chinese name|[[Xie (surname)|Xie]]}} '''Xie Bingying''' ({{Zh|s=谢冰莹|t=謝冰瑩|p=Xiè Bīngyíng|w=Hsieh Pingying}}; September 5, 1906—January 5, 2000) was a Chinese [[soldier]] and [[writer]] born in [[Loudi|Loudi, Hunan]]. Xie was one of the first female soldiers in modern history, and participated in the [[Northern Expedition (1926–1927)|Northern Expedition]]. Her literary reputation started with her military diaries. She was arrested in [[Japan]] for resistance activities in 1935. In 1948 she moved to [[Taiwan]] to escape the coming [[communist]] rule, and became a professor at the [[National Taiwan Normal University]]. In 1974 she emigrated to the [[United States]]. ==Main works== *''Girl Rebel: the autobiography of Hsieh Pingying, with extracts from her new war diaries (Adet and Anor Lin)'', Da Capo Press, New York, 1940 *''Autobiography of a Chinese Girl: a genuine autobiography (Tsui Chi)'', G. Allen & Unwin, London, 1943 *''A Woman Soldier's Story: The Autobiography of Xie Bingying,''translated by Lily Chia Brissman and Barry Brissman, Columbia University Press, New York, 2001. {{Authority control|VIAF=79405141}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Xie, Bingying | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese soldier and writer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1906 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2000 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xie, Bingying}} [[Category:1906 births]] [[Category:2000 deaths]] [[Category:American women writers]] [[Category:American writers of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Chinese non-fiction writers]] [[Category:Chinese women writers]] [[Category:People from Loudi]] [[Category:Republic of China writers]] [[Category:Taiwanese writers]] [[Category:Writers from Henan]]
